text:
Walton Sanders Goggins Jr. (born November 10, 1971) is an American actor. He is known for roles in movies such as Clay Hawkins in "Lincoln" (2012), Billy Crash in "Django Unchained" (2012), Chris Mannix in "The Hateful Eight" (2015), Lawrence in ' (2018), Mathias Vogel in "Tomb Raider" (2018), and Sonny Burch in "Ant-Man and the Wasp" (2018). On television, his roles include Shane Vendrell in "The Shield" (2002–2008), Boyd Crowder in "Justified" (2010–2015), Venus Van Dam in "Sons of Anarchy" (2012–2014) and Lee Russell in "Vice Principals" (2016–2017). He was nominated for a Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Drama Series for his work in "Justified".
Goggins also produced and starred in the short movie "The Accountant" (2001), which won an Academy Award for Best Live Action Short Film.
Goggins was born in Birmingham, Alabama. He grew up in Lithia Springs, Georgia. He was married to Canadian businesswoman Leanne Kaun from 2001 until her death by suicide in 2004. He married Nadia Conners in 2011. The couple's son was born later that year.

annotations.surface_form: Academy Award for Best Live Action Short Film
